The National Broadband Plan is not self-executing.  Rather, it is a set of fact-based and data-driven recommendations for a coherent U.S. broadband strategy for the next decade.  At the direction of Congress, the Plan was written and developed by the staff of the Federal Communications Commission – an independent agency of the U.S. federal government.  The Executive Branch, the Federal Communications Commission, and the Congress each now have the opportunity to evaluate the recommendations and act upon them to the extent they see fit.
